stories.text:
I know how to make them, and I've made a lot for personal use and a gaming group I'm a part of. Everyone else my age is starting to get jobs - why not use the web dev knowledge I've already accumulated?

My issue is on the business side. Why would anyone choose me - or even know it's an option - instead of someone professional? I can't just make a portfolio site and call it a day.

I'd appreciate some advice. I'm in the UK.
stories.title: Ask HN: I'm 15. I would like to make websites for money. How do I get clients?
Toward a smarter electronic health record

stories.text:
Hi, Assume you have an application with bronze, silver, and gold "tiers" for which you charge $1, $2, and $3 respectively. Let's say you can click on one button with bronze, two buttons with silver, and three buttons with gold.

Do you hard-code these business rules, or do you use a rules-engine? What is your go-to way to implement things like trials, discounts, etc. in the product?

What is your go-to way to fragment all the features into a feature grid/matrix and grant/deny/limit/meter access to any given feature on the fly? Do you have successful examples using rules engines for that?

Thank you,

Previous submission with no discussion: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=28454775
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you implement business rules for product assortments and tiers?
